H0.text: Expansion joints prevent railroad tracks and roadways from buckling on hot days.

H1.text: Cartilaginous joints are the sufficient structural component that railroad tracks and roadways require to avoid buckling on hot days.

H2.text: Contraction joints are what railroad tracks and roadways need in sufficient quantity to prevent buckling on hot days.

H3.text: Attraction joints are what railroad tracks and roadways require to prevent buckling on hot days.

A4.text: Expansion joints are designed to allow deflection in the axial (compressive), lateral (shear), or angular (bending) deflections.

A5.text: Bridge expansion joints are designed to allow for continuous traffic between structures while accommodating movement, shrinkage, and temperature variations on reinforced and prestressed concrete, composite, and steel structures.
